The initial string is "0", then becomes "07", "05", "03", but when converted to integer, those are 7,5,3.

void unite(int x, int y) {

}

#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#include <stdlib.h>

// Function declarations

int root(int x, int *par);

void unite(int x, int y, int *par, int *rank, int *size);

int aaa(char *n_str, int N);

int main() {

    // Read input for File1

    int n;

    scanf("%d", &n);

    int *a = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {

        scanf("%d", &a[i]);

    }

    // Process File1's logic

    int *par = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

    int *rank = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

    int *size = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {

        par[i] = i;

        rank[i] = 1;

        size[i] = 1;

    }

    int *b = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

    memset(b, 0, n * sizeof(int));

    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {

        int t = a[i];

        b[t-1] = i;

    }

    int c =0;

    for (int i = n-1; i >=0; i--) {

        int k = b[i];

        int l =1, r=1;

        // Check left

        if (k >0 && a[k-1] > a[k]) {

            int rx = root(k-1, par);

            l += size[rx];

            unite(k-1, k, par, rank, size);

        }

        // Check right

        if (k+1 <n && a[k+1] > a[k]) {

            int ry = root(k+1, par);

            r += size[ry];

            unite(k+1, k, par, rank, size);

        }

        c += l * r * a[k];

    }

    // Now, process File2's part

    char s_str[20];

    sprintf(s_str, "%d", c);

    int len = strlen(s_str);

    int even_0=0, even_1=0, odd_0=0, odd_1=0;

    for (int i=0; i < len; i++) {

        char c = s_str[i];

        if (i%2 ==0) {

            if (c == '0') even_0++;

            else if (c == '1') even_1++;

        } else {

            if (c == '0') odd_0++;

            else if (c == '1') odd_1++;

        }

    }

    int option1 = (even_0 + odd_1);

    int option2 = (even_1 + odd_0);

    int min_changes = (len - option1) < (len - option2) ? (len - option1) : (len - option2);

    // Now process File3's part

    int N = min_changes;

    // Call aaa with "0"

    char initial[2] = "0";

    int result = aaa(initial, N);

    printf("%d\n", result);

    // Free memory

    free(a);

    free(par);

    free(rank);

    free(size);

    free(b);

    return 0;

}

// Implement root and unite functions

int root(int x, int *par) {

    if (par[x] != x) {

        par[x] = root(par[x], par);

    }

    return par[x];

}

void unite(int x, int y, int *par, int *rank, int *size) {

    x = root(x, par);

    y = root(y, par);

    if (x == y) return;

    if (rank[x] < rank[y]) {

        par[x] = y;

        size[y] += size[x];

    } else {

        par[y] = x;

        size[x] += size[y];

        if (rank[x] == rank[y]) {

            rank[x]++;

        }

    }

}

// Implement aaa function

int aaa(char *n_str, int N) {

    int n = atoi(n_str);

    if (n > N) return 0;

    // Check if all digits are 7,5,3 and exactly those three

    int has7=0, has5=0, has3=0;

    int valid =1;

    for (int i=0; n_str[i]; i++) {

        char c = n_str[i];

        if (c == '7') has7=1;

        else if (c == '5') has5=1;

        else if (c == '3') has3=1;

        else {

            valid =0;

            break;

        }

    }

    if (!valid || has7 ==0 || has5 ==0 || has3 ==0) {

        return 0;

    }

    int ans =1;

    char new_str[20];

    for (int i=0; i<3; i++) {

        char digit = "753"[i];

        sprintf(new_str, "%s%c", n_str, digit);

        ans += aaa(new_str, N);

    }

    return ans;

}
